p: MeV belongs to the Morbillivirus genus within the Paramyxoviridae family and Mononegavirales order. This enveloped virus produces pleiomorphic viral particles with an average size ranging from 150 to 300 nm and up to 900 nm [ 12]. Its genome is a negative-sense, single stranded RNA of 15,894 nucleotides that encodes six structural proteins: The nucleocapsid (N) protein, the phosphoprotein (P), the matrix (M) protein, the fusion (F) protein, the haemagglutinin (H) protein, and the polymerase (large, L) protein. Two non-structural proteins, V and C are produced from the P gene [ 13] and mainly alter the innate immune sensing and response [ 14, 15, 16, 17].
